appearance: Molding exhibits deformations and twists (deviation from desired shape).
cause:
1.Unsuitable molding design and distinct differences in wall thickness resulting in different internal mold pressures and in different shrinkage behavior.
2.Incorrect position and design of sprue.
3.Due to incorrect setting of mold temperature and injection speed as well as unsuitable design of mold temperature control.
correction:
1.Avoid internal stresses and alignments by the correct choice of material and parts geometry (balancing wall thicknesses); optimization of the molding with the aid of computer programs (e. g. moldflow study).
2.Check the sprue location and match it to the molded part to be produced.
3.Optimization of processing conditions.
